t: Psalm 94
The*pn Lord*s is a God who avenges. O*ld God who avenges, shine forth.
Rise*ln up, Judge of the earth; pay*ld back to the proud what they deserve.
How*ln long, Lord,*s will the wicked, how*ld long will the wicked be jubilant?
They*pn pour out arrogant words; all*ld the evildoers are full of boasting.
They*ln crush your people, Lord;*s they*ld oppress your inheritance.
They*ln slay the widow and the foreigner; they*ld murder the fatherless.
They*ln say, “The Lord*s does not see; the*ld God of Jacob takes no notice.”
Take*pn notice, you senseless ones among the people; you*ld fools, when will you become wise?
Does*ln he who fashioned the ear not hear? Does*ld he who formed the eye not see?
Does*ln he who disciplines nations not punish? Does*ld he who teaches mankind lack knowledge?
The*ln Lord*s knows all human plans; he*ld knows that they are futile.
Blessed*pn is the one you discipline, Lord,*s the*ld one you teach from your law;
you*ln grant them relief from days of trouble, till*ld a pit is dug for the wicked.
For*ln the Lord*s will not reject his people; he*ld will never forsake his inheritance.
Judgment*ln will again be founded on righteousness, and*ld all the upright in heart will follow it.
Who*pn will rise up for me against the wicked? Who*ld will take a stand for me against evildoers?
Unless*ln the Lord*s had given me help, I*ld would soon have dwelt in the silence of death.
When*ln I said, “My foot is slipping,” your*ld unfailing love, Lord,*s supported me.
When*ln anxiety was great within me, your*ld consolation brought me joy.
Can*pn a corrupt throne be allied with you— a*ld throne that brings on misery by its decrees?
The*ln wicked band together against the righteous and*ld condemn the innocent to death.
But*ln the Lord*s has become my fortress, and*ld my God the rock in whom I take refuge.
He*ln will repay them for their sins and*ld destroy them for their wickedness; the*ld Lord*s our God will destroy them.
